intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. nontunensis, commonly known as the Sierra Valley buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers and trifoliate leaves. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly smaller flowers and shorter petals compared to the typical *R. auricomus*. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. The plant is an herbaceous perennial, typically growing to a height of 10–30 cm.
